channel.title: Comments on: Coconut and Cardamon Burfi

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description: Hi Everyone - they are lovely and great for small serves and even taking to work! Thanks again for the comments! :)
item.content:encoded: Hi Everyone – they are lovely and great for small serves and even taking to work! Thanks again for the comments! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.dc:creator: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.description: These look lovely. The different flavours sound so delicious. I think I need to try something like this, soon!
item.content:encoded: These look lovely. The different flavours sound so delicious. I think I need to try something like this, soon!

item.title: By: Lubna Karim
item.dc:creator: Lubna Karim
item.description: Oh wow....looks yummy...my favourite one...adding cardamom makes it more flavourful....
item.content:encoded: Oh wow….looks yummy…my favourite one…adding cardamom makes it more flavourful….

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: Pistachio and cardamon sounds like a great combination, and they look pretty rolled in coconut. They'd be perfect finger food for a party or a picnic.
item.content:encoded: Pistachio and cardamon sounds like a great combination, and they look pretty rolled in coconut. They’d be perfect finger food for a party or a picnic.

item.title: By: Sophia
item.dc:creator: Sophia
item.description: Oh my god, what precious balls of ecstasy! coconut and cardamom flavours with little chunks of pistachio? Sounds like heaven!
item.content:encoded: Oh my god, what precious balls of ecstasy! coconut and cardamom flavours with little chunks of pistachio? Sounds like heaven!

item.title: By: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.dc:creator: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.description: These look so pretty, and they are bite size which is always a bonus in my books. I've never made any indian sweets before, but I adore pistachio so maybe I should give it a go
item.content:encoded: These look so pretty, and they are bite size which is always a bonus in my books. I’ve never made any indian sweets before, but I adore pistachio so maybe I should give it a go

item.title: By: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.description: I've never made my own Indian sweets from scratch (I have used those packets though) so this is a real treat getting a from scratch recipe!
item.content:encoded: I’ve never made my own Indian sweets from scratch (I have used those packets though) so this is a real treat getting a from scratch recipe!
